answers.answer: Hi there!It is normal for the penis to be slightly deviated to one side. Retraction of the foreskin could indicate underlying adhesions/ fibrosis and may need an evaluation by a doctor; while erectile dysfunction can develop in young adults due to a variety of causes. Psychological stress, performance anxiety, depression, neurogenic disorders peyronie's disease, body image issues, medications, alcohol, smoking, drugs/medications, hormonal imbalance, radiation therapy, kidney failure, metabolic disorders, multiple sclerosis, hypertension, diabetes, prostatitis, urethritis etc. just to name a few. Anxiety and stress play an important role in adolescents in the development of erectile dysfunction; and is the most common possible cause. At a primary level, I would suggest being a bit relaxed and working on the psychological factors with your partner. It might also be beneficial to get rid of factors like smoking/ alcohol/ drugs, if involved. In case this doesn’t work, or you have difficulty controlling anxiety; I would suggest seeing your primary care physician for an evaluation of the above mentioned causes and appropriate specific treatment.Hope this helps.Take care!

question: i am 23 years  old. i started hand sex at the age  of 12. i was shaking my penis 3 to 4 times a day. now my penis is not getting  strong as before. and because i was shaking it without removing underwear it has been bent towards left. iwas taking out the penis from the leg openings of the underwear. and one more thing is my foreskin of penis is over slided than anyones penis. because i was shaking it hardly. so what will happen?This discussion is related to/posts/Urology/I-have-stretched-my-penis-skin-way-too-far-Please-Help/show/497193.
title: penis
